['', '5+ Years of hands-on design and development experience in data space : data processing / data transformation using ETL tools, data warehouse (data modeling, programming), RDBMS', 'Azure Cloud experience is major plus (willing to consider AWS, GCP, PCF, etc.)', 'Direct/Perm Hire$125,000 - 145,000 annual salary plus bonusIndefinite Remote Work (ultimately reporting onsite ATL)', 'Indefinite Remote Work (ultimately reporting onsite ATL)', '3+ years professional data engineering experience focused on batch and real time data pipelines using Spark, PySpark, Python, SQL, Java', 'Direct/Perm Hire', 'Senior Data Engineer', '$125,000 - 145,000 annual salary plus bonus', 'Please forward resumes to Steve Fritsch (sfritsch@eliassen.com)', 'Qualifications:\xa0', '5+ Years of hands-on design and development experience in data space : data processing / data transformation using ETL tools, data warehouse (data modeling, programming), RDBMS3+ years professional data engineering experience focused on batch and real time data pipelines using Spark, PySpark, Python, SQL, JavaExperience with a DevOps model utilizing a CI/CD tool is preferred\xa0Azure Cloud experience is major plus (willing to consider AWS, GCP, PCF, etc.)', 'Experience with a DevOps model utilizing a CI/CD tool is preferred\xa0', 'We are looking for a talented Senior Data Engineer to join our Enterprise Data Organization responsible for driving data transformation for nationally recognized brands. The Data Engineer will build and manage our data pipeline (data ingest, data transformation, data distribution, quality rules, data storage etc.) for an Azure cloud based data platform. In this role you will design, develop and maintain reliable automated data solutions including, but not limited to, data models, database objects, stored procedures and views.']

['', 'Essential Functions', ' Develop run books and documentation to detail all data infrastructure design and operations, including backup and recovery. ', ' Identify, evaluate, and implement infrastructure solutions for unified business intelligence, data warehousing, scaling and parallel processing, and machine learning ', ' Collaborate with the peer Engineering team to ensure data quality and to advise on the design and implementation of system integrations and API services. ', ' Migratory Bird Initiative, a multi-year project to track and aggregate varied data sources about migratory bird species, where they go, and the threats they face ', ' Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, or related quantitative field strongly preferred. ', ' Familiarity with machine learning/data science platforms and services like Sagemaker, Domino, TensorFlow, etc. a plus. ', ' 7 years of experience as a Data Engineer, or in similar roles, with increasing levels of responsibility. ', ' Take ownership of building and maintaining the new data infrastructure, including data platforms, data pipelines, and analytical and business intelligence tools. ', ' Integrate data from multiple sources (e.g., email, website interactions, CRM and volunteer activity, voter files, demographic data to support inclusion and equity metrics) into a data warehouse and building optimized views and workflows for analysis, reporting, and dashboard visualization ', ' Genuine passion for conservation and the mission of the National Audubon Society.', ' Work with the VP of Data and Analytics and the Director of IT to support data governance initiatives and to ensure the reliability and security of data services and infrastructure. ', ' Advise on the design, build, and maintenance of structured databases to track curated data such as bird species taxonomies, bird-friendly native plants by geolocation, and important bird areas, along with product and engineering staff ', 'Position Summary', ' Contribute to the design of a new strategic data infrastructure to support the National Audubon Society mission.  Take ownership of building and maintaining the new data infrastructure, including data platforms, data pipelines, and analytical and business intelligence tools.  Develop run books and documentation to detail all data infrastructure design and operations, including backup and recovery.  Collaborate with the Enterprise Geographic Information Systems (GIS) team to leverage enterprise GIS and mapping technologies as part of the overall data architecture.  Advise the VP of Data and Analytics, as well as others throughout the organization, on data-related tools and platforms, data best practices for integrity, testing, and modeling, and analytical approaches.  Collaborate with the peer Engineering team to ensure data quality and to advise on the design and implementation of system integrations and API services.  Work with the VP of Data and Analytics and the Director of IT to support data governance initiatives and to ensure the reliability and security of data services and infrastructure. ', ' Migratory Bird Initiative, a multi-year project to track and aggregate varied data sources about migratory bird species, where they go, and the threats they face  Integrate data from multiple sources (e.g., email, website interactions, CRM and volunteer activity, voter files, demographic data to support inclusion and equity metrics) into a data warehouse and building optimized views and workflows for analysis, reporting, and dashboard visualization  Identify, evaluate, and implement infrastructure solutions for unified business intelligence, data warehousing, scaling and parallel processing, and machine learning  Proactive data analysis to identify issues and implement a plan to improve the quality and integrity of operational data, particularly constituent data across data-heavy systems like Salesforce and EveryAction  Advise on the design, build, and maintenance of structured databases to track curated data such as bird species taxonomies, bird-friendly native plants by geolocation, and important bird areas, along with product and engineering staff  Convert raster data of predictive bird species ranges based on climate change models to vector features to enable enterprise GIS analysis and further conservation research ', ' Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences. ', ' Experience with or strong understanding of ETL/ELT and workflow tools like AWS Glue and Apache Airflow. ', ' Experience with business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, PowerBI). ', ' Experience supporting data science notebook environments such as Jupyter Hub or R Studio preferred. ', 'They Will Work Closely With The VP Of Data And Analytics To Design And Implement a New Strategic Data Platform For The National Audubon Society That Will Support Projects Such As', ' Experience with RDBM Systems and deep SQL experience. ', ' Significant hands-on experience building and working with data lakes, warehouses, marts, pipelines, and providing reporting or analytical services. ', ' Experience building data architectures that support web application such as RESTful web services. Familiarity with web data and mapping visualization technologies such as D3.js, Plotly, ArgGIS API for JavaScript, and Leaflet a plus. ', ' Self-starter who can work as part of a virtual team and remain motivated in a dynamic environment. ', ' Experience with or strong understanding of big data architectures and data modeling to efficiently process large volumes of data, including solutions like Spark, Hadoop, EMR, Kafka, etc. ', ' Convert raster data of predictive bird species ranges based on climate change models to vector features to enable enterprise GIS analysis and further conservation research ', 'Overview', ' Fluency in Linux-based operating systems. ', ' Experience with cloud data warehouse solutions like Redshift, Snowflake, Azure Data Warehouse, and/or BigQuery. ', ' 7 years of experience as a Data Engineer, or in similar roles, with increasing levels of responsibility.  Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, or related quantitative field strongly preferred.  Significant hands-on experience building and working with data lakes, warehouses, marts, pipelines, and providing reporting or analytical services.  Fluency in Linux-based operating systems.  Experience with RDBM Systems and deep SQL experience.  Experience with cloud data warehouse solutions like Redshift, Snowflake, Azure Data Warehouse, and/or BigQuery.  Experience with cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS EC2, S3, Lambda or equivalent services from Azure or Google).  Experience with Linux scripting, Python, Java, Scala, .NET, R or other programming languages proven to be robust and widely used for ETL/ELT and data analytics.  Experience with business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, PowerBI).  Experience with or strong understanding of ETL/ELT and workflow tools like AWS Glue and Apache Airflow.  Experience with or strong understanding of big data architectures and data modeling to efficiently process large volumes of data, including solutions like Spark, Hadoop, EMR, Kafka, etc.  Experience supporting data science notebook environments such as Jupyter Hub or R Studio preferred.  Experience building data architectures that support web application such as RESTful web services. Familiarity with web data and mapping visualization technologies such as D3.js, Plotly, ArgGIS API for JavaScript, and Leaflet a plus.  Familiarity with machine learning/data science platforms and services like Sagemaker, Domino, TensorFlow, etc. a plus.  Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences.  Self-starter who can work as part of a virtual team and remain motivated in a dynamic environment. ', 'Qualifications And Experience', ' Experience with Linux scripting, Python, Java, Scala, .NET, R or other programming languages proven to be robust and widely used for ETL/ELT and data analytics. Follows', "Responsible for leading a multi-functional team that will use advanced analytics for improving the Janssen patient experience by uncovering and addressing patient pain points in starting and staying on therapy Structure and identify key patient experience challenges/opportunities into use cases and advanced analytics solutionsOversee machine learning model development and provide thought leadership for advanced analytical solutions to better understand and quantify at which points and why patient’s drop-off in the journeyProvides insight to the business partner in terms of multi-functional, highly skilled teams (e.g. data scientists, data engineers, machine learning engineers, designers) in designing, implementing, deploying and scaling analytics applications/digital interventions to solve critical patient pain points Provide leadership in the development of a new longitudinal patient data set to enable deeper analytical insightsLead story development and presentation of analytical solutions to ensure stakeholder buy-inProvides insight to the business in terms of what impactful “state of the art” looks like the area of advanced analyticsSupport the development effortDevelopment of a credo-based company culture that emphasizes quality, continuous improvement, key employee retention and development, and high performance. Janssen Research and Development, L.L.C., a division of Johnson and Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Principal Scientist, Cardiovascular and Metabolism (CVM) – Biomarkers, focusing in the Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension (PAH) Area of Cardiovascular and Metabolism (CVM) to be located in Spring House, PA.At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to create a world without disease. Transforming lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease inspires us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science.We are Janssen. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Learn more at www.janssen.com and follow us @JanssenGlobal. Janssen Research & Development, LLC is part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies.The CVM Biomarker Team is an integrated group of scientists composed of experts in Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension and many other Cardiovascular and Metabolic Areas. Together, the Biomarker Team will provide the key learnings/insights on the next wave of novel therapies for these patients. Organizationally, the Biomarker Team serves as a pivotal bridge between Discovery Research and the later phase Clinical Development group. The Biomarker Team provides the necessary scientific expertise combined with Translational Medicine to advance an industry-leading pipeline of novel mechanism small molecules and biologic agents to address unmet need in CVM diseases.The CVM Biomarker Team has a broad remit stretching from support of discovery with human data to support target selection, through development of novel decision-making biomarkers for early phase clinical trials, target-centric indication sequencing and prioritization, and biomarker support of regulatory filings. It has expertise in biomarker development, disease biology research and in the application of CVM and data science technologies to support drug discovery and development.The Principal Scientist will be a leader in the CVM Biomarker team focusing on drug discovery projects and the design and implementation of novel experiments and interpretation of data to lead in the clinical progression of innovative therapies in Pulmonary Hypertension. The successful candidate will be responsible for building and executing on the strategy to drive assets in the PAH disease area. He/She will lead will work with Discovery Scientists and be accountable for the design and execution of lab experiments for human-based in vitro models, new assay development and data interpretation. The candidate will bring an enthusiastic discovery mentality to the CVM Biomarker Team.The Principal Scientist will be effective in his/her ability to lead in the execution, guidance and troubleshooting of lab experiments for human-based in vitro models and new assay development for disease understanding, target identification, and disease indication exploration. The candidate will lead and develop the timely creation and implementation of high caliber translational biomarker plans in support of key milestones for preclinical and clinical portfolio programs. Additional activities include partnering with Discovery, TM scientists and external partners to drive the strategy for disease understanding, target identification, and disease indication exploration. The Principal Scientist will be expected to be proactive in support of decision making to project teams. The successful candidate will serve as a lead for PAH preclinical and/or clinical programs in the development and implementation of high caliber translational biomarker packages. Further, the candidate will operate in a highly collaborative environment interacting with multiple internal and external stakeholders contributing high quality and timely deliverables as assessed by stakeholders such as the project team, the clinical trial team, and Biomarker Team leadership.Responsibilities Are As Follows Ensure strong translational package for the evaluation of new target identification, target evaluation, and indication selection in collaboration with teams from discovery through to clinical development Directly conduct relevant biomarker analyses in the lab, and coordinate biomarker measurements with internal and external supporting groups or CROs Lead strategies enabling the design and implementation of novel experiments for disease understanding, target identification, and disease indication exploration Guide team members in the communication of study results and guide stakeholders in applying those results to making strategic decisions Work closely with key leaders in partner functions to ensure project goals are met Contribute to the strategies on molecular understanding of human diseases, patient stratification and biomarker-based endpoint translational strategies Represent CVM Biomarkers on program discovery and development teams Contribute to the overall department’s strategic direction with special focus on increasing the impact of translational science approaches in drug discovery and development Lead internal and external collaborations to increase team capabilities or address a strategic need Help build an extensive external network of leaders to enable strategic partnerships and awareness of advances in translational and biomarker research Prepare and/or direct the preparation and review of protocols, clinical study reports and Biomarker sections of Translational plans, IBs, INDs, abstracts, manuscripts, and technical reports Make recommendations for investment and leadership of key external collaborationsQualifications Ph.D. with a minimum of 8 years of relevant biomarker or translational research experience in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry sectors is required Proven record on publication of biomarker data in high-quality scientific, technical or medical journals is required Previous experience in Cardiovascular & Metabolism biomarkers is preferred Experience in leading a research/biomarker team, motivating and influencing people is required Experience in establishing and implementing biomarker and precision medicine strategies at the project and disease area level is required Experience in transitioning biomarker strategies from pre-clinical to clinical setting, including implementation of biomarker plans in clinical studies and review and interpretation of data is preferred Ability to work in a cross-functional environment and represent biomarker/precision medicine area in the projects and contribute to decision making is preferred. In-depth understanding of the research laboratory environment; familiarity with all basic and some complex laboratory equipment / instrumentation is required Demonstrated ability to work on assay development in a laboratory setting, and generate and accurately document data is required Willingness to spend 40-50% time at the bench is required Understanding of the overall process of drug discovery and development is required Experience with clinical diagnostics and their uses is preferred Extensive experience with clinical sample handling is preferred Prior experience in working with external companies and alliance partners, and in managing successful research collaborations is required Dynamic entrepreneurial mindset This position is located in Spring House, PA and may require up to 10% travel.Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. ['', 'Education And Experience', 'Provides statistical advice for study planning, execution, and reporting.', 'Clinical Data Scientist Biostatistician for Global Medical Affairs', ' Master’s degree or PhD degree (preferred) from an accredited college/university in Biostatistics, Statistics, Data Science or related fields, with 2-5 years of relevant experience in public health, clinical/ biological research or microbiological data mining. Knowledge of principles and practices of diagnostic/pharmaceutical clinical research including statistical analysis methodologies and experimental design. Knowledge and/or experience in the fields of Microbiology and/or In Vitro Diagnostics (IVD) would be of benefit. Experience in extracting, cleaning, preparing, and modeling data. Proficiency in analysis packages (eg, R, SAS) or programming languages (eg, Python, Ruby, Java). Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook); Access &/or SQL or other relational databases preferred. Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, rigorous scientific writing and proof-reading skills. and ability to manage/prioritize multiple projects from conception to completion. Strong written and oral communication skills. Ability to work well in cross-functional teams (across geography and culture) with a group of people with diverse background, skill sets and personalities. Team player, flexible and adaptable. ', 'Knowledge of principles and practices of diagnostic/pharmaceutical clinical research including statistical analysis methodologies and experimental design.', 'Communicates results and educates others through insightful visualizations, reports, publications and presentations.', 'Manages system configurations including instrument, tool, and software requirements to ensure timely execution of studies. Retrieves and analyzes data from a variety of sources (eg, study sites/systems, hospital information systems, LIS).', 'Trains study database end users. ', 'Leads data management of studies by envisioning data flow and then designing, validating, and implementing a robust database.', 'Develops data analysis plans using appropriate statistical methodology.', 'Team player, flexible and adaptable.', 'Ensures that study databases are of high quality and satisfy analysis requirements.', 'Master’s degree or PhD degree (preferred) from an accredited college/university in Biostatistics, Statistics, Data Science or related fields, with 2-5 years of relevant experience in public health, clinical/ biological research or microbiological data mining.', 'Develops and implements risk based monitoring for all phases of data collection.', 'Ability to work well in cross-functional teams (across geography and culture) with a group of people with diverse background, skill sets and personalities.', 'Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook); Access &/or SQL or other relational databases preferred.', 'Location: Negotiable, but preference for St. Louis, MO', 'Prepares oral and written reports to effectively communicate study results.', 'Strong written and oral communication skills.', 'Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, rigorous scientific writing and proof-reading skills. and ability to manage/prioritize multiple projects from conception to completion.', 'Proficiency in analysis packages (eg, R, SAS) or programming languages (eg, Python, Ruby, Java).', 'Main Accountabilities', 'Analyzes data to meet the objectives of the study protocol. Independently applies and implements basic and complex techniques for these analyses.', 'Utilizes a diverse array of data mining, analytics and modeling tools to generate and test working hypotheses, deliver insights and actionable recommendations in diverse health care domains such as pathogen resistance tracking and antibiotic stewardship.', 'Proactively forecasts data trends, including deviations and deficiencies.', 'Knowledge and/or experience in the fields of Microbiology and/or In Vitro Diagnostics (IVD) would be of benefit.', 'Experience in extracting, cleaning, preparing, and modeling data.', ' Provides statistical advice for study planning, execution, and reporting. Develops data analysis plans using appropriate statistical methodology. Leads data management of studies by envisioning data flow and then designing, validating, and implementing a robust database. Ensures that study databases are of high quality and satisfy analysis requirements. Trains study database end users.  Develops and implements risk based monitoring for all phases of data collection. Proactively forecasts data trends, including deviations and deficiencies. Analyzes data to meet the objectives of the study protocol. Independently applies and implements basic and complex techniques for these analyses. Prepares oral and written reports to effectively communicate study results. Manages system configurations including instrument, tool, and software requirements to ensure timely execution of studies. Retrieves and analyzes data from a variety of sources (eg, study sites/systems, hospital information systems, LIS). Utilizes a diverse array of data mining, analytics and modeling tools to generate and test working hypotheses, deliver insights and actionable recommendations in diverse health care domains such as pathogen resistance tracking and antibiotic stewardship. Communicates results and educates others through insightful visualizations, reports, publications and presentations. ']

['We are looking for a User Experience (UX) Researcher who is passionate about delivering better experiences and being a vocal advocate for people’s needs. ', "As a UX Researcher on our Product Design team, you will not only conduct best-in-class, multi-method research, you'll also develop deep research-driven product expertise with the responsibility of shaping the core User Experience within various Product Design platforms. ", 'What You’ll Do At Bayer ', '• Passion and curiosity paired with uncanny observational and analytical skills. ', '• Facilitate workshops to accelerate toward innovations and new business solutions using industry best practice frameworks such as IBM’s Design Thinking and Google Venture’s Design Sprints. ', '\xa0 ', '• A relentless determination to do what is right for the users and stakeholders. ', '• Engaging, inspiring and clear communicator. ', 'MUST be authorized to work in the US without sponsorship-no exceptions.', 'For this position, we are open to mid-level and senior-level candidates.', 'Experience We’re Looking For ', 'You’ll work on a highly-collaborative team of product designers and researchers within the Design Studio - across multiple smaller efforts or dedicated to one larger end-to-end effort. You will partner closely with engineers, product managers, and platform leads to build well-crafted digital tools. We build consensus around our work in everyday interactions through design reviews, workshops, user testing, and presentations to influence the direction of a product, and to inspire the company as a whole. ', '• The ability to manage ambiguity and work autonomously in a fast-paced environment.', 'This position is an ongoing contract with a 12 month minimum with a Global 500 company.\xa0 ', '• Transform open questions into formal research plans to advise feature development and roadmaps. ', '• Turn findings into meaningful insights that generate empathy and encourage action on behalf of our users, customers and potential customers. ', 'All candidates MUST be authorized to work in the US without sponsorship-no exceptions. ', '• Pragmatic instincts – you know how to compromise to balance business needs with methodological exactitude and timelines. ', ' ', ' All candidates MUST be authorized to work in the US without sponsorship-no exceptions.   ', 'For this position, we are open to mid-level and senior-level candidates. ', 'What You’ll Do At Bayer', 'Experience We’re Looking For', '• Conduct research with users across the globe using a range of methods (usability labs, contextual interviews, surveys, etc.) through the product development cycle. ']

Define standards, best practices, and certification processes for data objects. Work is performed without appreciable direction.Exercise considerable latitude in determining technical objectives and approaches to assignment.Complete work is reviewed from a relatively long-term perspective, for desired results.Guide the successful completion of major programs and may function in a project leadership role. ['', 'We are passionate about creating memorable experiences for our fans and the best in class experience for our employees. Vivid Seats offers competitive compensation levels, individual and team-based bonus opportunities, 401K matching, a generous benefits package and Flex PTO policy plus a variety of workplace perks.\xa0', 'What We Offer:\xa0', 'As a\xa0Senior Data Engineer,\xa0you will\xa0maintain a holistic view of the Vivid Seat’s data architecture with an understanding of how it relates to the systems that depend upon it. You’ll partner with engineering teams to create data models and assist in designing our transactional data stores. This includes designing and building data systems and automated processes\xa0for our\xa0underlying cloud infrastructure and deployment pipelines.\xa0You’ll mature operational stability of the data platform through best practices, automation and monitoring while staying up to date on new and emerging technologies, planning accordingly to incorporate valuable concepts to enhance our data schema and capabilities.\xa0', 'At Vivid Seats, you will have the opportunity to work with the flexibility and speed of a startup; while operating at massive, profitable scale. We keep our teams lean, allowing each employee direct accountability of creating a positive ticket buying experience. We are relentless and move quickly to release new features and content to our applications. Good ideas are heard and implemented, and hard work rewarded. Being a part of our team means having the ability to drive impact and own the innovation that connects our tens of millions of unique monthly users to the memorable experiences that only live events create.\xa0\xa0', 'Senior Data Engineer,\xa0', 'Additional Experience of Interest:', '\xa0', 'Experience with continuous integration, testing, and deployment using tools such as\xa0Jenkins\xa0', 'Experience with containerization such as Docker\xa0', 'Experience with\xa0configuration as\xa0code tools such as Ansible, Terraform etc.\xa0', 'The Opportunity:\xa0', 'A willingness to participating in an on-call rotation\xa0', '111 N Canal Suite #800\xa0\xa0', 'Cloud experience with either GCP, AWS or Azure and experience running data platforms within a cloud environment\xa0', 'Expert knowledge of a relational database platform such as MySQL, Postgres, Oracle or SQL Server\xa0', 'This position will start remotely.', '\ufeffLocation:\xa0', 'Chicago, IL 60606\xa0\xa0', '\ufeffLocation', 'What We Offer:', 'ETL pipeline and tooling experience\xa0', 'Coding and scripting experience using Java, Python or Bash\xa0', 'To be successful, you’ll need:\xa0', 'Additional Experience of Interest:\xa0', 'Experience with\xa0configuration as\xa0code tools such as Ansible, Terraform etc.\xa0Experience with containerization such as Docker\xa0Experience with continuous integration, testing, and deployment using tools such as\xa0Jenkins\xa0', 'Experience in either modeling transaction or data warehousing with an interest in learning both methodologies\xa0', 'Vivid Seats is the largest independent online ticket marketplace, sending tens of millions of fans to live events. Experiences Matter - which is why we continue to grow year over year. Working at Vivid Seats puts you front and center at the opportunity to scale our best in class platform that allows our fans to sit closer and experience more.\xa0\xa0', 'Expert knowledge of a relational database platform such as MySQL, Postgres, Oracle or SQL Server\xa0Experience in either modeling transaction or data warehousing with an interest in learning both methodologies\xa0ETL pipeline and tooling experience\xa0Coding and scripting experience using Java, Python or Bash\xa0Proficiency in working in a Linux environment\xa0Cloud experience with either GCP, AWS or Azure and experience running data platforms within a cloud environment\xa0A willingness to participating in an on-call rotation\xa0', 'To be successful, you’ll need:', 'Proficiency in working in a Linux environment\xa0', ':\xa0', 'The Opportunity:', 'This position will start remotely.\xa0', 'Location']

job_title: Senior Research Scientist / 40 Hours / Day / BWH - Global Health Equity
job_text: ['', 'Schedule', 'Work Locations', ' Doctoral degree in public health (program with a strong quantitative component required) ', ' Minimum 5 years post-doctoral experience conducting quantitative, qualitative and mixed methods research in low- and middle-income countries ', 'Recruiting Department', ' Strong interpersonal skills to work with collaborators, stakeholders, and team members ', ' Intermittent domestic or international travel ', ' Commitment to health equity ', ' Research strategy – Under the overall guidance of the PI, lead a collaborative process to develop a program of quantitative, qualitative, and mixed methods research, with the goal of evaluating NCD program initiatives, including costing and program evaluations, NCD integration science modeling and evaluation, and evidence-based policy reviews. ', " Experience in epidemiological study design and analysis of health outcome data  Expertise in health economic evaluation, including analysis of cost-related data  Extensive experience with Stata software (also experience with 'R' preferred)  Experience working in the field in a resource-limited setting  Experience collaborating with and mentoring local researchers in resource-limited settings  Excellent communication, verbal, writing, and presentation skills  Strong interpersonal skills to work with collaborators, stakeholders, and team members  Exceptional organizational skills, ability to prioritize multiple tasks, and careful attention to detail  Commitment to health equity  Experience and interest in vulnerable populations globally  Demonstrated professionalism and respect for human subject research ", 'Job', ' Publication – Take a lead role in developing and implementing a publishing agenda for the research outputs of both the Boston-based team and site-based researchers, including identifying topic. ', ' Grant development – In collaboration with Dr. Bukhman and other staff, identify opportunities and develop research grant applications related to integration science and NCD service delivery at the sites for submission to NIH and similar organizations. ', ' Experience in epidemiological study design and analysis of health outcome data ', ' Experience and interest in vulnerable populations globally ', 'Employee Status', 'Job Posting', ' Oversight of research activities and deliverables – In collaboration with Boston- and site-based staff, develop timelines and work plans for completing the research outputs, and implement a system of regular follow-up to ensure timely progress towards achieving the research goals. ', ' Expertise in health economic evaluation, including analysis of cost-related data ', ' Exceptional organizational skills, ability to prioritize multiple tasks, and careful attention to detail ', 'Standard Hours', ' Full-time with occasional evenings and weekends ', ' The nature of our global work may entail teleconferences in the early morning or evening ', ' Doctoral degree in public health (program with a strong quantitative component required)  Minimum 5 years post-doctoral experience conducting quantitative, qualitative and mixed methods research in low- and middle-income countries  Familiarity with NCDs and injuries as a subject area for implementation science ', 'Shift', 'Working Conditions', ' Familiarity with NCDs and injuries as a subject area for implementation science ', ' Study design – Provide guidance on design of research studies that will yield robust and meaningful results and contribute to the evidence base required for successful implementation, evaluation, adaptation, and potential scale-up of integrated care delivery models for severe NCDs and injuries. ', 'Skills', ' Experience collaborating with and mentoring local researchers in resource-limited settings ', ' Full-time with occasional evenings and weekends  Intermittent domestic or international travel  The nature of our global work may entail teleconferences in the early morning or evening  Two-year term with additional years likely depending on performance ', ' Program strategy – Collaborate with Program, Implementation, and Policy Directors to ensure that the research strategy and outputs are aligned with the overall activities and goals of the broader NCDI Poverty Initiatives. ', ' Experience working in the field in a resource-limited setting ', ' Mentorship – Work collaboratively with other members of the research team, providing guidance and mentorship on study design, data analysis, and manuscript preparation and submission. ', 'Responsibilities Will Include', ' Demonstrated professionalism and respect for human subject research ', " Extensive experience with Stata software (also experience with 'R' preferred) ", 'Primary Location', ' Research strategy – Under the overall guidance of the PI, lead a collaborative process to develop a program of quantitative, qualitative, and mixed methods research, with the goal of evaluating NCD program initiatives, including costing and program evaluations, NCD integration science modeling and evaluation, and evidence-based policy reviews.  Program strategy – Collaborate with Program, Implementation, and Policy Directors to ensure that the research strategy and outputs are aligned with the overall activities and goals of the broader NCDI Poverty Initiatives.  Oversight of research activities and deliverables – In collaboration with Boston- and site-based staff, develop timelines and work plans for completing the research outputs, and implement a system of regular follow-up to ensure timely progress towards achieving the research goals.  Study design – Provide guidance on design of research studies that will yield robust and meaningful results and contribute to the evidence base required for successful implementation, evaluation, adaptation, and potential scale-up of integrated care delivery models for severe NCDs and injuries.  Mentorship – Work collaboratively with other members of the research team, providing guidance and mentorship on study design, data analysis, and manuscript preparation and submission.  Publication – Take a lead role in developing and implementing a publishing agenda for the research outputs of both the Boston-based team and site-based researchers, including identifying topic.  Grant development – In collaboration with Dr. Bukhman and other staff, identify opportunities and develop research grant applications related to integration science and NCD service delivery at the sites for submission to NIH and similar organizations. ', 'Organization', ' Two-year term with additional years likely depending on performance ', ' Excellent communication, verbal, writing, and presentation skills ']

['', ' Work with the Principal Investigators, Directors, and Bioinformatics team at the Earle A. Chiles Research Institute to assess and optimize bioinformatics applications, web-based bioinformatics tools, and create novel computational approaches and analytical tools as needed. Analyze large molecular datasets such as genomic sequence data, flow cytometry, multispectral immunohistochemistry, and proteomics data for basic science and translational clinical research projects, primarily focused on immuno-oncology. Contribute to multi-omic workflows and build computational workbook-based analyses leveraging integrated data in cloud computing environments. ', 'Proven success in independent effort and delivering high quality data with biological relevance in a team environment', 'Commonly used database and bioinformatics tools for NGS data analysis (e.g.) bedtools, SAMtools, IGV, ANNOVAR, Bowtie, GATK, ChimeraScan, UCSC Genome Browser, Galaxy, SoftGenetics, CLC bio, TopHat, etc.).', ' Large dataset analysis in R. Analyzing next generation sequencing data (DNA-seq, RNA-seq, etc.). Commonly used database and bioinformatics tools for NGS data analysis (e.g.) bedtools, SAMtools, IGV, ANNOVAR, Bowtie, GATK, ChimeraScan, UCSC Genome Browser, Galaxy, SoftGenetics, CLC bio, TopHat, etc.). Web framework (e.g. Django, Sinatra, Rails or others). HTML/CSS, Javascript and SQL on NoSQL databases Basic knowledge about molecular biology and genomics Proficiency in a scripting language (e.g. Python/Perl/Ruby) and *nix environments ', 'Providence is calling a Bioinformatics Scientist 1', 'Analyze large molecular datasets such as genomic sequence data, flow cytometry, multispectral immunohistochemistry, and proteomics data for basic science and translational clinical research projects, primarily focused on immuno-oncology.', 'HTML/CSS, Javascript and SQL on NoSQL databases', 'Experience With The Following', " Bachelor's Degree in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Computer Science, or Biology Significant computational experience 2 years' experience related to bioinformatics work in a clinical laboratory or experience in academia, biotechnology, or other healthcare field (preferably involving next generation sequence data analysis) First-hand experience in NGS analysis and methods as well as the computing infrastructure and data management methods to support NGS First-hand multi-parametric data mining experience on expression, copy number and profiling datasets for target identification and biomarker discovery. For example, multivariate analysis; dimensionality reduction methods; parametric and non-parametric statistical methods; Bayesian statistics; pattern recognition or classification methods First-hand experience at integrating publicly or commercially available genetic, genomic, and interaction datasets with novel experimental data to identify testable hypotheses Proven experience and success in a team-oriented environment Proven success in independent effort and delivering high quality data with biological relevance in a team environment ", 'Preferred qualifications for this position include:', 'Our Mission', 'Qualifications', 'Req ID:', 'Web framework (e.g. Django, Sinatra, Rails or others).', 'Basic knowledge about molecular biology and genomics', 'About Us', 'Description', 'Shift:', 'First-hand multi-parametric data mining experience on expression, copy number and profiling datasets for target identification and biomarker discovery. For example, multivariate analysis; dimensionality reduction methods; parametric and non-parametric statistical methods; Bayesian statistics; pattern recognition or classification methods', 'We are seeking a Bioinformatics Scientist 1 who will be responsible for providing comprehensive bioinformatics support to the Providence Portland Cancer Institute and the Earle A. Chiles Research Institute for the analysis and interpretation of advanced high throughput molecular, genomic, and clinical data types including gene expression, imaging, electronic medical records, etc. The Bioinformatics Scientist 1 will develop and apply bioinformatics methods and software tools for analysis and integration with clinical information and perform tasks to reduce and consolidate data output to help interpret and prioritize findings for numerous immuno-oncology focused projects.', 'Job Category:', 'Analyzing next generation sequencing data (DNA-seq, RNA-seq, etc.).', "2 years' experience related to bioinformatics work in a clinical laboratory or experience in academia, biotechnology, or other healthcare field (preferably involving next generation sequence data analysis)", 'For Information On Our Comprehensive Range Of Benefits, Visit', 'Required qualifications for this position include:', 'About Providence In Oregon', 'Location:', 'Significant computational experience', 'to Providence Portland Medical Center in Portland, Oregon. This is a full-time position with benefits.', 'First-hand experience in NGS analysis and methods as well as the computing infrastructure and data management methods to support NGS', 'Large dataset analysis in R.', 'Schedule:', 'Work with the Principal Investigators, Directors, and Bioinformatics team at the Earle A. Chiles Research Institute to assess and optimize bioinformatics applications, web-based bioinformatics tools, and create novel computational approaches and analytical tools as needed.', 'Proven experience and success in a team-oriented environment', "Bachelor's Degree in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Computer Science, or Biology", 'In This Position You Will Have The Following Responsibilities', 'First-hand experience at integrating publicly or commercially available genetic, genomic, and interaction datasets with novel experimental data to identify testable hypotheses', 'Contribute to multi-omic workflows and build computational workbook-based analyses leveraging integrated data in cloud computing environments.', 'Proficiency in a scripting language (e.g. Python/Perl/Ruby) and *nix environments']

['Do you dream in entity relationship diagrams? Think you can stump the CTO with an SQL question — and would you like to work someone where the CTO wants you to be smarter than they are?', '', 'ICX is building a world-class data practice, and we’re looking for expert database engineers to help us achieve our ambitious goals. We have embraced Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and are building batch and streaming workflows atop it using Dataflow (Apache Beam), Cloud Run, CloudSQL (PostgreSQL) and BigQuery, orchestrated using Cloud Composer (Apache Airflow). Our preferred languages are Python and Golang. We are seeking candidates with strong relational modeling and SQL knowledge, skills, and experience. If you’re an engineer that wants to concentrate in data engineering or an experienced data scientist that is interested in making a move to the engineering side, this may be a great opportunity for you.', 'The ICX data engineering team has embraced a remote-first approach to working and has members that span Eastern to Pacific time zones. This opportunity is open to US citizens and legal permanent U.S. residents who are authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship.']

['', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Can you win it more efficiently?', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Regularly monitor UPC performance to identify poorly performing SKUs and work back with customer to remove or replace.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Carry out monthly confirmation of spend by brand by platform in conjunction with agencies.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0If campaign is underspending determine cause and inform brand of potential underspend well before IO end date.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Experience with a paid search platform (Criteo, Promote IQ)', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Interest in working in the eRetail Paid Search Space', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0If expected IOs are missing, work back with brand, agency and retailer to resolve.', 'Handling Keyword Support', 'Years of experience needed? 1-2 years experience', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Ensure that strong SKUs are winning and identify similar SKUs to add to campaigns.', 'Brand experience- no experience necessary.', 'Expected Deliverables:', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Communicating desired keywords to paid search platforms.', 'Communication', 'How clients will they be interacting on a day-to-day basis?\xa0One single point of contact.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Develop a moderately understanding of how the platforms work and how they are different from one to another', 'Certifications Needed?\xa0No', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0If campaign capping out daily, inform brand and see if they want to determine what sufficiency looks like.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Align with brand on target SOV', '2.\xa0\xa0\xa0Curiosity- curious and inquisitive- strong self-motivator/starter', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Ensure appropriate keywords tied to campaigns/UPCs', 'Budget Tracking', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Power BI', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Align with brands on intended spend. The brands generally have a budget in mind that they can share.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0If winning goal', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Comfortable navigating multiple dashboards, retailer websites, team spaces and SharePoint folders to monitor and manage paid search campaigns.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Monitor retailer sites and webscraping data to ensure keywords are serving sponsored spots as expected.', 'Share of Voice (SOV) tracking', '3.\xa0\xa0\xa0Trading platforms- being comfortable with excel and navigate shared point folders', 'Job Description Attached', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Ensure that platforms are executing IO as expected - i.e. correct dollar amount and time frame are in the dashboard.', 'Detailed Role Description(s):\xa0\xa0A Paid Search Technologist is responsible for managing eRetail Paid Search campaigns and ensuring they are efficiently delivering on specified KPIs. This includes regularly monitoring campaign performance metrics and budgets and making optimizations as needed. Communication is a key aspect of this role as the Paid Search Technologist will be communicating with the internal customers, retailer platforms and team Data Scientists. This role requires a high level of comfort navigating a wide variety of retailer websites, paid search platforms as well as Microsoft team spaces and SharePoint folders. The Paid Search Technologist is expected to have a firm grasp on their brands online presence especially in the search results space across all relevant retailers.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Expert level Excel, Team Space and SharePoint skills are required.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0In order for reporting infrastructure to ingest campaign information, every campaign must have meta data associated with the campaign. Ensure all of your campaigns have updated meta data at all times.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Handling Keyword Support', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Ensure we are spending against the IO as intended', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Confirm budgets are accurate for your campaigns in budget pacing report.', 'Campaign Meta Data Updates', 'UPC Performance', 'What does the interview process look like? 2- 30 minute calls', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Align with retailers on received/accepted IOs (should be shared via sharepoint folders).', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Progress on campaign performance and strategy execution - is it working? Are changes needed?', '4.\xa0\xa0\xa0Paid Search experience- promoting products or brands', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Strong interest in continuously monitoring paid search results across multiple retailers', '1.\xa0\xa0\xa0Communication is key', 'Actualizations', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Understanding platforms is important for executing campaigns. All campaigns have subtleties that can have a big impact on how we execute on that platform.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Communicating campaign performance or challenges to Data Scientist team members', 'Title:\xa0Paid Search Technologist', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0If sponsored spots are not showing as expected, work with platform/retailer to resolve', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Determine if it is a CPC issue - is there room to bid more from a ROAS standpoint', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0A basic understanding of algorithms is not needed but could be beneficial in understanding how bidding algorithms, etc work.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0If keywords are serving sponsored spots but your brand isn’t winning, work with platform/retailer and Data Scientists to resolve.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0How much does is cost? If above ROAS guidance, communicate with brand to determine how to proceed.', 'Standout Qualities:\xa0\xa0\xa0•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Paid search experience would be beneficial but is not required', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Basic Python (or other programming) skills could be useful but are not needed for this role - there are no programming tasks associated with this role.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Working with brands to recommend SKU changes or other strategy changes as needed', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0See keyword support above', 'Communication with the brands/categories and paid search platforms/retailers is an important part of this role. The following communication topics will be a regular part of this role:', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Add desired keywords (as defined by brand strategy) to campaigns were applicable.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0If not winning goal', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Skills: •\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Very strong communication skills are required and are critical for all parts of this role. This is a client facing role - communication with customers will be required.', 'Platform Expertise', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Extreme attention to detail is mandatory. There are constant moving parts associated with paid search - budget changes, SKU changes, strategy changes. Missing a detail can result in significant over spend or promoting products that aren’t aligned with the brand’s strategy.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Familiarity with the online shopping space (Target.com, Walmart.com, etc); last mile grocery delivery (Instacart.com, Shipt.com, etc)', 'What are the top 3 must have skills needed for this role?', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Align with brand on their desire to pace out evenly or over-spend - unless the brand explicitly states a desire to overspend in writing, we will always adhere to autopacing based on the IO terms.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Ensure campaigns are delivering on SOV goal.']

['This role will be responsible for expanding our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross-functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler, who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up.\xa0This position will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts, and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.\xa0The successful candidate will: · Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture; · Assemble large, complex data sets that meet both functional and non-functional business requirements; · Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.; · Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS ‘big data’ technologies; · Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics; · Collaborate with stakeholders including the executive, product, data and design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs; · Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader; · Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems. A successful Data Engineer will have: · A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science Engineering, Data Analytics, or a related technical degree.\xa0Technical requirements: · Five+ years of experience working with distributed data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark, Kafka, Flink etc) for building efficient, large-scale ‘big data’ pipelines; · Strong Software Engineering experience with proficiency in at least one of the following programming languages: Golang, Java, Python, Scala or equivalent; · Implement data ingestion pipelines both real time and batch using best practices; · Experience with building stream-processing applications using Apache Flink, Kafka Streams or others; · Experience with Cloud Computing platforms like Amazon AWS, Google Cloud etc.; · Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment; · Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra. · Ability to work in a Linux environment. Ideal qualifications: · Experience in building distributed, high-volume data services; · Experience with big data processing and analytics stack in AWS: EMR, S3, EC2, Athena, Kinesis, Lambda, Quicksight etc.']

['', 'Act as the face of insights and analytics within Nando’s by developing strong relationships with key stakeholders.', 'Self-motivated: initiative to undertake or continue a task or activity without prodding or supervision', 'At Nando’s, we want to be the most loved restaurant brand in North America, sharing the spirit of Nando’s PERi-PERi with everyone who chooses to access it. We will redesign and build a business that thrives as it answers fully it is consumers’ needs -and endures over time through genuinely putting people at the heart of what we do. We will lead with our values and act with care, compassion, and kindness. By doing this, we will Change Lives Together, every day and everywhere.', 'Acts as an internal consultant, collaborating with clients to identify research questions, establish hypotheses, determine metrics to be assessed, and interprets the results of analyses to drive insight; must be able to communicate and explain the results of more technical analyses to business partners in a digestible, visual fashion and recommend ways to further inform and evaluate the success of an ongoing initiative.', 'REPORTING', 'Creative and lateral thinking', 'Analytical skills', 'Consults with the Marketing Department on the impact of marketing and operational initiatives on our overall profitability, and labor', 'Project management skills', 'Negotiation skills', 'Conscientious: hardworking, diligent, and reliable', 'Integrity: adherence to accepted principles of right and wrong, interesting in doing the right thingCredible: honest, trustworthy, accountable, and dependableGenuine: keeping everyone’s best in at heart', 'Networking skills', "Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, data science, or related field; MBA or master’s preferred.", 'As part of the planning and analytics team, the Senior Manager is responsible for not only fostering a sense of endless curiosity and camaraderie among the team but also independently managing workstreams for a wide variety of internal clients. The ideal candidate is a unique combination of skills. Part researcher, part planner, part data scientist, he or she is a true hybrid with unmatched analytics skills as well as the ability to draw actionable insights from different data sources and clearly, passionately communicate data stories to audiences of all levels and backgrounds. The Senior Manager will be responsible for defining the future of the planning and analytics team and helping Nando’s future expansion. As with all members of the Nando’s family, the Senior Manager, Planning and Analytics will be expected to wear multiple hats, seek out opportunities to make Nando’s and themselves better every day, and in general, be a good team player! job_title: EDW Data Engineer (Enterprise Data & Digital Health)
job_text: ['', 'Schedule', ' Ability to troubleshoot system bottleneck and conduct performance tuning in large data warehouse or data lake', ' Strong SQL skills and workload management on multi-processing data platform (preferred MPP systems) Ability to troubleshoot system bottleneck and conduct performance tuning in large data warehouse or data lake Experience with logical and physical data modeling Experience with real time data processing and analytics products is a plus 3 plus years of experience with building larger data warehouse in SQL Server, SSIS 3 years Informatica, Talend data integration tool is a plus Familiarity with data engineering, data governance and data quality principles Healthcare experience, most notably in Clinical data, Epic, Payer data and reference data is a plus Health Catalyst knowledge is a plus', ' Perform EDW ETL/ELT ingestions and integrations to ensure support data and analytic needs Build and enhance standard solution that provides efficient and scalable ETL/ELT solutions from multiple data sources Ensure the quality of data assets and robustness of data engineering processes Experience with change control, release management and other ITIL processes Participate in building out existing EDW in SQL Server and new Data Lake, expanding and optimizing the data ecosystem, as well as optimizing data engineering processes Support BI Developers, Data Architects, Data Analysts and Data Scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects Participate ETL/DB solution, code and pre-prod review to ensure data build and delivery architecture is efficient and consistent throughout ongoing projects Use/s the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration 3 plus years of experience architecting and building data ingestions and data integration solution for Enterprise Data and Analytics Solutions Advanced level of experience with ETL/ELT tools Experience supporting and enhancing existing Enterprise Data Warehouse or Data Lake Experience designing systems that are highly reliable, self-recovering, and require little or no supporting manpower Familiar with change control, release management, and other ITIL methodology', 'Work Locations', ' Familiar with change control, release management, and other ITIL methodology', 'GENERAL SUMMARY / OVERVIEW', 'Principal Duties And Responsibilities', 'Recruiting Department', ' Experience supporting and enhancing existing Enterprise Data Warehouse or Data Lake', ' 3 plus years of experience with building larger data warehouse in SQL Server, SSIS', ' Participate ETL/DB solution, code and pre-prod review to ensure data build and delivery architecture is efficient and consistent throughout ongoing projects', ' Possible local travel to Partners sites, vendors, and conferences', 'Job', ' While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; talk; or hear; use hands to finger; handle; or feel; reach with hands and arms. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision and depth perception.', ' Support BI Developers, Data Architects, Data Analysts and Data Scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects', ' Experience with change control, release management and other ITIL processes', 'Team Description', ' 3 years Informatica, Talend data integration tool is a plus', 'Employee Status', 'Job Posting', ' Experience with logical and physical data modeling', ' Normal office working conditions. ['', ' Passion and curiosity paired with uncanny observational and analytical skills.', 'Position Description', ' Conduct research with users across the globe using a range of methods (usability labs, contextual interviews, surveys, etc.) through the product development cycle.', ' Pragmatic instincts – you know how to compromise to balance business needs with methodological exactitude and timelines.', ' Turn findings into meaningful insights that generate empathy and encourage action on behalf of our users, customers and potential customers.', " Transform open questions into formal research plans to advise feature development and roadmaps. Conduct research with users across the globe using a range of methods (usability labs, contextual interviews, surveys, etc.) through the product development cycle. Turn findings into meaningful insights that generate empathy and encourage action on behalf of our users, customers and potential customers. Facilitate workshops to accelerate toward innovations and new business solutions using industry best practice frameworks such as IBM's Design Thinking and Google Venture's Design Sprints.", ' A relentless determination to do what is right for the users and stakeholders.', ' Transform open questions into formal research plans to advise feature development and roadmaps.', ' Engaging, inspiring and clear communicator.', ' Engaging, inspiring and clear communicator. Pragmatic instincts – you know how to compromise to balance business needs with methodological exactitude and timelines. Passion and curiosity paired with uncanny observational and analytical skills. A relentless determination to do what is right for the users and stakeholders. The ability to manage ambiguity and work autonomously in a fast-paced environment.', ' The ability to manage ambiguity and work autonomously in a fast-paced environment.', " Facilitate workshops to accelerate toward innovations and new business solutions using industry best practice frameworks such as IBM's Design Thinking and Google Venture's Design Sprints."]

['', ' Demonstrate knowledge and ensure compliance with current and applicable global PV regulations/guidelines (e.g., CIOMS, EMA, FDA, ICH, etc.)', ' Other duties as assigned by manager', ' In conjunction with the Senior Director and/ or other designees , support proactive pharmacovigilance signal detection and risk management planning for designated Zymeworks products, including signal identification, evaluation, interpretation of safety signals and trends and communication (written and verbal) of safety risks Prepare and author reports of aggregate safety data such as DSURs, 6 monthly Suspected Unexpected Serious Adverse Reactions (SUSARs) reports, Pharmacovigilance Plans, Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy Plans (REMS), and EU Risk Management Plans under the guidance of the Senior Director, according to the agreed process and timelines Key member of the Safety Management Team including setting agenda, producing necessary data outputs, facilitating discussions, and documenting conclusions Participate in the preparation and maintenance of Reference Safety Information (RSI) and product labeling (e.g., Developmental Core Safety Information [DCSI] Company Core Safety Information [CCSI], Investigator Brochure [IB], etc.); co-ordinates meetings and tracks timelines to ensure completion', ' Efficient in time management and multi-tasking', ' Synthesize data from multiple sources and critical thinking skills as well as authoring monthly signaling reports Accountable for maintaining personal readiness in response to internal audit or regulatory inspection Other duties as assigned by manager', ' Excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as presentation and team-interaction skills are necessary', ' Contribute to the preparation and review of safety risk section(s) of Investigator brochures (IBs), protocols, informed consent/assent forms, clinical study reports/synopses, Integrated Summary of Safety )/Common Technical Document (CTD) submissions and other documents as needed; ensure risk-reduction strategies are implemented timely and appropriately in relevant documents', ' Healthcare Professional degree required (e.g. RN, PharmD, PA, MD) minimum of one year post-graduate clinical experience. job_title: Senior Principal Research Scientist and Center Director of the Biomedical Research Informatics
job_text: ['', 'PhD in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or related field with a concentration in machine learning focused on biomedical informatics, computational biology, or bioinformatics required.', 'Essential Functions', 'Equity, diversity, and inclusion guide our growth and strategy. We are looking for individuals who are passionate about, and committed to leading efforts to provide culturally relevant care, reducing health disparities, and helping build a diverse and inclusive team environment. All Nemours associates are expected to ensure that these philosophies are embedded in their day to day work with colleagues, patients and families. ', 'Ensure the facility meets all regulatory requirements; update policies and procedures as appropriate', 'PhD in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or related field with a concentration in machine learning focused on biomedical informatics, computational biology, or bioinformatics required.Demonstrated experience in machine learning using deep neural networks and related technologies as applied to biomedical informatics and/or bioinformatics.Demonstrated success in conceiving, directing, and obtaining grant funding for projects in these areas.Experience with Unix/Linux command shells, job scheduling systems for high performance computing, programming with Python, R, MatLab, or other scientific programming languages.', 'Obtain appropriate academic appointments with the University of Delaware or Thomas Jefferson University Medical School, or both, and maintain professional development plan.', 'Demonstrated success in conceiving, directing, and obtaining grant funding for projects in these areas.', 'A comprehensive CV and detailed Cover Letter are required in order for your application to be considered.***Essential FunctionsCo-manage BRIC , liaise, as appropriate, with department leadership. hospital divisions and other research laboratories and with other hospital and community physicians and scientistsUndertake independent and collaborative research, including the development of new data analytic procedures. Design, conduct, and publish original research in peer reviewed journals.Actively pursue external funding by initiating grant applications as PI and collaborating in submission of grant applications with others.Supervise staff of the laboratory; ensure that staff receive adequate training.Ensure the facility meets all regulatory requirements; update policies and procedures as appropriatePrepare and manage the annual laboratory budget; identify equipment needs; submit facility activity reports as required.Prioritize projects; ensure accuracy of design and analysis, interpretations and that deadlines are met. Serve on designated department committees and work groups.Obtain appropriate academic appointments with the University of Delaware or Thomas Jefferson University Medical School, or both, and maintain professional development plan.QualificationsPhD in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or related field with a concentration in machine learning focused on biomedical informatics, computational biology, or bioinformatics required.Demonstrated experience in machine learning using deep neural networks and related technologies as applied to biomedical informatics and/or bioinformatics.Demonstrated success in conceiving, directing, and obtaining grant funding for projects in these areas.Experience with Unix/Linux command shells, job scheduling systems for high performance computing, programming with Python, R, MatLab, or other scientific programming languages.Our dedication to professionals who are dedicated to children frequently earns Nemours a spot on the list of top workplaces in the communities we serve. Our Associates enjoy comprehensive benefits, including our unique “Bridge to a Healthy Future” pediatric health plan, an integrated wellness program, opportunities for professional growth, and much more. As an equal opportunity employer, Nemours focuses on the best-qualified applicants for our openings.', 'Demonstrated experience in machine learning using deep neural networks and related technologies as applied to biomedical informatics and/or bioinformatics.', 'As one of the nation’s leading pediatric health care systems, Nemours is committed to providing all children with their best chance to grow up healthy. We offer integrated, family-centered care to more than 300,000 children each year in our pediatric hospitals, specialty clinics and primary care practices in Delaware, Florida, Maryland, New Jersey and Pennsylvania. Nemours strives to ensure a healthier tomorrow for all children – even those who may never enter our doors – through our world-changing research, education and advocacy efforts. At Nemours, our Associates help us deliver on the promise we make to every family we have the privilege of serving: to treat their child as if they were our own. ', 'Undertake independent and collaborative research, including the development of new data analytic procedures. ', 'Qualifications', 'Experience with Unix/Linux command shells, job scheduling systems for high performance computing, programming with Python, R, MatLab, or other scientific programming languages.', 'Prepare and manage the annual laboratory budget; identify equipment needs; submit facility activity reports as required.', 'Prioritize projects; ensure accuracy of design and analysis, interpretations and that deadlines are met. Serve on designated department committees and work groups.', 'Senior Principal Research Scientist and Center Director of the Biomedical Research Informatics Center (BRIC)', 'Co-manage BRIC , liaise, as appropriate, with department leadership. hospital divisions and other research laboratories and with other hospital and community physicians and scientists', 'Design, conduct, and publish original research in peer reviewed journals.', 'Our dedication to professionals who are dedicated to children frequently earns Nemours a spot on the list of top workplaces in the communities we serve. Our Associates enjoy comprehensive benefits, including our unique “Bridge to a Healthy Future” pediatric health plan, an integrated wellness program, opportunities for professional growth, and much more. As an equal opportunity employer, Nemours focuses on the best-qualified applicants for our openings.', 'Supervise staff of the laboratory; ensure that staff receive adequate training.', 'Actively pursue external funding by initiating grant applications as PI and collaborating in submission of grant applications with others.', 'Co-manage BRIC , liaise, as appropriate, with department leadership. hospital divisions and other research laboratories and with other hospital and community physicians and scientistsUndertake independent and collaborative research, including the development of new data analytic procedures. Design, conduct, and publish original research in peer reviewed journals.Actively pursue external funding by initiating grant applications as PI and collaborating in submission of grant applications with others.Supervise staff of the laboratory; ensure that staff receive adequate training.Ensure the facility meets all regulatory requirements; update policies and procedures as appropriatePrepare and manage the annual laboratory budget; identify equipment needs; submit facility activity reports as required.Prioritize projects; ensure accuracy of design and analysis, interpretations and that deadlines are met. Serve on designated department committees and work groups.Obtain appropriate academic appointments with the University of Delaware or Thomas Jefferson University Medical School, or both, and maintain professional development plan.']
